@ Vauveli 

Don't worry about it. Millions of uploaders so the chances of you being singled out are small. Peer Guardian is designed to ban troublesome peers and doesn't hide your ip address. Also use PG with care because if someone from Africa is on a weak connection then they are going to take days to download files and you may think they are a bad peer. The internet infrastructure in Africa isn't as good as the USA or Europe. Also if you're uploading something for the first time then limit the number of people that can connect to you in your client's preferences menu. When I'm downloading I'll have UTorrent set to 25 or more peers per torrent but if I'm just seeding or uploading then I'll drop that down to 10 or even 5. If you're really worried then buy a USB prepaid dongle with no contract (you can buy a voucher at most newsagents to top them up which lasts a month). Upload with that which keeps your landline connection clean and is perfectly anonymous. If you do receive a letter or phonecall then always deny it and just say you had a short-term lodger (one or three months let) and you gave them access to your landline but they have now left. Change ISP if you get a letter from them. ISPs are in competition so they don't share info and once an ISP acts against you its time to leave that ISP.
